name: Structural non-validity or malformedness of received packages
description: Received packages fail to correspond to what repository expects or is capable of preserving.
notes:
- Does repository define the structure that should be conformed to by submitted content?
- Does repository stipulate acceptable formats? 

The full description of this risk has been obtained from examples provided in DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment, March 2007, Digital Curation Centre (DCC) and Digital Preservation Europe (DPE), http://www.repositoryaudit.eu/
preMitigationNotes:
- Deposited content is encoded in a format that is unsupported by the repository
- Deposited XML-encoded content does not validate against the schema provided by the repository
mitigationStrategy:
Avoidance strategies:
- Develop definition for submission package structure
- Establish list of acceptable formats for submission
- Communicate definition to depositors and producers In the event of riskâ€™s execution:
- Maintain policy and procedure to determine whether package is disposed of, returned or ingested
identifiedBy: DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment
